page.title: 06GARDENS AND WALKS IN MAWNAN
page.content: A great{tourist}attraction are the beautiful Spring{gardens}which were developed in the last century by rich business men who built second homes in Mawnan. In the sheltered valleys leading down to the sea their gardeners planted sub tropical plants including rhododendrons, camellias and azaleas. The largest is{Glendurgan}on average 200 people visit every day in season. They are owned by the{National {Trust}as are{Bosloe Gardens}which are much smaller.{Trebah}and{Carwinion {Gardens}are owned privately and are opened once a year for charity. The {Cornwall Coastal}Footpath runs completely around the coastal area starting from Maenporth. There are many beautiful picturesque views of the river. As you walk around {Rosemullion Head}there is alot of wildlife.The footpath ends at Durgan.
